boone

Class NetCompiler.BooneCompiledNet

  • java.lang.Object
    • boone.NetCompiler.BooneCompiledNet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NetCompiler.CompiledNet
    Enclosing class:
    NetCompiler

    protected static class NetCompiler.BooneCompiledNet
extends java.lang.Object
implements NetCompiler.CompiledNet
    The Boone CompiledNet instance.

      protected Function[] activationFn
      Activation function.
      protected double[] bias
      Neuron biases.

      Calculation order.
      protected double[] externalInput
      the external input signal, meant for the input of input neurons.
      protected double[] input
      Current input signal.
      protected int[] inputNeurons
      Indices of the input neurons, in the correct order.

      The sum of the inputs from the links to this neuron.

      Sink neurons of the links.

      Source neurons of the links.

      Loop back output to the linkInput after every cycle? Default: false.
      protected int maxCycles
      max number of network cycles, usually just 1.
      protected int numInputNeurons
      Number of input neurons.

      Number of links.

      Total number of neurons.
      protected int numOutputNeurons
      Number of output neurons.

      Array of arrays of links from the given neuron to other neurons.
      protected double[] output
      Current unit output.
      protected int[] outputNeurons
      Indices of the output neurons, in the correct order.
      protected int[] tickList
      Tick list, for random calculation order.
      protected boolean[] undirected
      Flag whether this Link is undirected.
      protected boolean[] usingBias
      Am I using the bias? Default: true.
      protected double[] value
      Link value.
      protected double[] weight
      Weight of this link.
      protected boolean zeroInputAfterFirstCycle
      Reset the external input of the input neurons to zero after the first cycle when innervating the network? Probably only useful for recurrent networks, where the internal per-neuron feed-back should take over (see Neuron.loopOutputToInput).

    • Field Detail

      • numNeurons

        protected int numNeurons
        Total number of neurons.

      • numInputNeurons

        protected int numInputNeurons
        Number of input neurons.

      • inputNeurons

        protected int[] inputNeurons
        Indices of the input neurons, in the correct order.

      • numOutputNeurons

        protected int numOutputNeurons
        Number of output neurons.

      • outputNeurons

        protected int[] outputNeurons
        Indices of the output neurons, in the correct order.

      • numLinks

        protected int numLinks
        Number of links.

      • activationFn

        protected Function[] activationFn
        Activation function. default: Function.Sigmoid.

      • usingBias

        protected boolean[] usingBias
        Am I using the bias? Default: true.

      • loopOutputToInput

        protected boolean[] loopOutputToInput
        Loop back output to the linkInput after every cycle? Default: false.

      • bias

        protected double[] bias
        Neuron biases.

      • externalInput

        protected double[] externalInput
        the external input signal, meant for the input of input neurons.

      • linkInput

        protected double[] linkInput
        The sum of the inputs from the links to this neuron. This is calculated step by step in the propagateLink(int, double, boolean) method.
        This is a kind of replacement for the initial activation value in other net models.

      • input

        protected double[] input
        Current input signal. Calculated in the calculateNeuron(int) method by adding the linkInput and the externalInput values.

      • output

        protected double[] output
        Current unit output.

      • outLinks

        protected int[][] outLinks
        Array of arrays of links from the given neuron to other neurons.

      • linkSourceNeuron

        protected int[] linkSourceNeuron
        Source neurons of the links.

      • linkSinkNeuron

        protected int[] linkSinkNeuron
        Sink neurons of the links.

      • weight

        protected double[] weight
        Weight of this link.

      • value

        protected double[] value
        Link value. Specifically, the forward link value.

      • undirected

        protected boolean[] undirected
        Flag whether this Link is undirected. false by default.

      • maxCycles

        protected int maxCycles
        max number of network cycles, usually just 1. Mostly used for recurrent networks.

      • zeroInputAfterFirstCycle

        protected boolean zeroInputAfterFirstCycle
        Reset the external input of the input neurons to zero after the first cycle when innervating the network? Probably only useful for recurrent networks, where the internal per-neuron feed-back should take over (see Neuron.loopOutputToInput).

        Default: false.

      • calcOrder

        protected int calcOrder
        Calculation order. See NeuralNet.calcOrder.

      • tickList

        protected int[] tickList
        Tick list, for random calculation order.

        Extract the output pattern from the network.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
